name: Table Rock Jungle Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in September with my husband while on vacation. We absolutely loved staying at Table Rock. The rooms, food, beverages, staff and location are wonderful!
reviews.title: Fabulous and Unique Way to Experience Belize

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arranged a transfer from the airport with Table Rock and it all went very seamlessly. After an hour and a half drive to San Ignacio we arrived at Table Rock and were met by the friendly Jose who showed us to our cabana, the Aracari, and oriented us with the property. The property is expansive, lush, and well maintained and we enjoyed walking through the orchards, picking fruit and either munching on it or feeding it to the resident donkeys. We ordered the meal plan and were very pleased with the decision. The alternative for food is an expensive (USD20-30) and bumpy cab ride into town if you don’t have a rental car, and we quite liked having gourmet food while in the middle of the jungle. The food was fabulous and so filling! The chef is extremely talented and makes delectable food. Yes, the meal plan is a bit pricey but you are truly getting what you pay for. My only critique is that the food is very Americanized, i.e. steaks, pork chops, chicken breast, so if you are looking for authentic Belizean food you’re better off going into town occasionally. Since we were heading to San Pedro after Table Rock we figured we’d get enough Belizean cuisine there.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was perfect and we found the bed to be quite comfortable. The bedding was soft, and in fact, most of the linens and towels are imported from the States since the quality of these products aren’t as nice in Belize. The ceiling fan kept us very comfortable while we slept at night and I would not be concerned at all that there is no A/C here. The bathroom is large and the shower even larger. My one critique here is that the lighting is very dim in the shower area so it’s difficult to see. The water also cycles between very hot and cold while you’re in there which was a bit of a nuisance but you have to remember that you’re in the jungle at a lodge that is 100% off the grid. They generate their own power and capture rain water for the showers, so while I realize that I’m being picky, I also realize that the amenities are fabulous considering where you’re staying. Because this is the jungle, also be aware that you might find some critters in your room. We had a cockroach in the bathroom that we weren’t able to kill ourselves but when we told the staff they immediately tried to get rid of it. Again, it comes with the territory and is something to be aware of and this may happen at any lodge in the jungle, not just at Table Rock.
reviews.title: Love, Love, Love Table Rock!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Finally, we enjoyed the amenities around the property. There were canoes and inner tubes provided that were essentials for spending a day on the Macal River, which I highly recommend. You can easily burn an entire day at the property, either swinging in a hammock, navigating the river, or exploring the property in general. For us, four days was a perfect length to spend in the jungle. We got to go on two tours, spend an entire day at Table Rock, and enjoy an afternoon in San Ignacio and didn’t feel like we missed out on anything. It's also worth noting that the staff is spectacular at Table Rock. The owners and staff make it a point to get to know their patrons without being intrusive and it creates a relaxing, inviting atmosphere. I highly recommend Table Rock to anyone wanting to lose themselves in the middle of the Belizean jungle!
reviews.title: Memories That Will Last a Lifetime!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could not have asked for a more wonderful place to spend the beginning of our honeymoon. My fiance and I had never been to Belize and while I am all for adventure my fiance was not game to spend our honeymoon roughing it. Alan and Colleen were amazing from our first email. They put all of my fiance's fears of the Jungle at ease and we will never forget this experience. From the moment we arrived to the last sad look as we left I could not have asked for a better adventure. Our room was so romantic and the staff so friendly and helpful. We arranged all of our tours through Table Rock (after asking a million questions ot decide which ones to take...ha!) and all of our guides were above and beyond. I tend to ask a million questions when I'm in a new place to learn the culture and I feel like we are now friends with everyone we enountered. If you want to be social and make friends you can - if you would rather keep to yourselves and have a romantic dinner for two - you can! I'm already trying to plan our next trip to visit!
reviews.title: Amazing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights on our first trip to Belize last week. The drive from Belize City in our rental car was easy (under two hours), with the exception of the final twenty minutes, which were really tough. I had read that the road was bad, but I didn't believe that it could actually be *this* bad. We got used to it though, going back and forth between San Ignacio and Table Rock a few times over the next few days. So with hindsight I would choose this mode of transportation again as we value the added flexibility.
reviews.title: Wonderful place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were rewarded for the rough trip: the setting of the lodge is amazing, the dining area lovely, the rooms are very clean and the property is very well maintained (with the exception of the driveway!). Lots of exciting wildlife to spot, too. The local staff were unbelievably genuine and friendly, and the dinners absolutely delicious. The owners joined us for drinks every night, and were overall great hosts. I wish we could have stayed here longer.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon Destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I had an absolutely fantastic time at Table Rock during our Belize honeymoon. It's a great spot for couples who want the luxury of not having to plan anything (all-inclusive) but who would be stir-crazy sitting by a resort pool all day. The service is top-notch and you get to know the entire staff and owners. Staying at Table Rock is a very intimate experience, you get to know your fellow guests, mainly because there are a very small number of guest cottages and everyone dines together under a beautiful palapa with cocktail bar. The food was probably our favorite part, we wanted to bring Chef George home with us!
reviews.title: Table Rock Rocks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: As for the adventure, there are dozens of things to do and Table Rock will book everything for you, arrange guides and transportation, and send you with a packed lunch if its a full day trip. Definitely go to the ATM cave. We also had a lot of fun just hanging at the property, picking fruit, relaxing in hammocks, and floating the river with a tube and beer.
reviews.title: Thoughtful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shout out to Jose and Marty, and to Ranger (guide dog extraordinaire)
reviews.title: Didn't Want to Leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband, our 2 children, and I stayed at Table Rock for 3 nights and really enjoyed our time here. It is a small, intimate lodge that, as another reviewer stated, really does feel like a bed and breakfast. The pros: Clean, comfortable rooms in small, thatched roof buildings. They provide canoes for exploring the river, and walking/exploring the grounds is very nice. The best part of the lodge is definitely the food. Every night our meals were excellent, and breakfast was also delicious. They were also very accomodating to our kids. The cons (which really are nit-picky): The rooms are not all very private - it would be nice to have a more secluded porch area to sit at. A couple of the staff were a bit surly, definitely not as warm and welcoming as other places we have been in Belize. The tours booked through the hotel are very expensive (but I think tours booked through any hotel are pricey -- it may be better to book directly through an agency). I would definitely recommend this lodge for a unique jungle experience.
reviews.title: Nice Stay in San Ignacio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at two locations on our recent trip to Belize, Table Rock for our inland stay and Matachica for our island stay. We can highly recommend both. Both have beautiful grounds, outstanding staffs, and excellent accommodations.
reviews.title: Best Food in Belize

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main difference between the two was the food. Where the food was ok at Matachica, it was simply unbelievable at TableRock. My wife and I were constantly blown away by how good it was no matter what the dish. Chef George picks up whatever is fresh from the market that day but he tries to vary day to day. We ate at several restaurants inland and on the island. While some of them were very good, none compared to the food at Riverside/Table Rock.
reviews.title: Exceeds Expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While at Table Rock, we went on two excursions, the ATM cave and Tikal. Both were simply outstanding experiences. Tikal is in Guatemala but I would not let that deter you from making the trip. While there are some parts of Guatemala that are unsafe, my wife and I felt at ease during the excursion. When it comes to booking your excursions, you can get them cheaper by booking in San Ignacio. However, those tours typically have a higher visitor to guide ratio. We booked ours through Table Rock and for both excursions we had our own tour guide just for the two of us. That's probably not the norm during the high season, but it still will be better than the bigger tour companies.
reviews.title: Jungle Paradise in Belize

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like just about every lodge near San Ignacio, there is no A/C. While temps do get down into the low 70s at night, it still is very humid. However, that's a small price to pay to stay and eat at such a wonderful place.
reviews.title: Home in the Jungle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I begin... After an amazing wedding weekend in Sonoma, CA, it would have taken a lot to lift our spirits even higher. Table Rock delivered. As soon as we arrived and Jose gave us the tour, we were both floating on cloud 9.5. We did the 5-night honeymoon package, so all of our ground transfers and activities were setup for us in advance. Alan and Colleen (founders/owners), along with Mike, Jose, Marty, and the rest of the TR crew were all fantastic. Also, the food was amazing. We had a bit of everything; breakfast, lunch, dinner, and dessert, between two chefs, Estelle and George. The accommodations were lovely, we had the King Jungle View room, which was just so peaceful and comforting. Finally, the activities were all perfect. We had Adrian as our guide for Barton Creek, Xunantunich, Caracol, and Big Rock Falls, and he quickly felt like we were hanging out with a highly intelligent, old friend. And Renan took us to ATM, which was without a doubt the best adventure we've ever been on. All in all, I'd highly recommend Table Rock.
reviews.title: The Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Alan and Colleen are great! They were there to greet us every morning for breakfast and every evening for dinner. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make sure our children were taken care of and happy - even going so far as spending 20 minutes opening a coconut our son had picked. Every meal was excellant and chef George made special "kid friendly" meals for the children.
reviews.title: Family Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They set us up with a personal guide to the Caracal ruins who was absolutely first class!
reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon/couple retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: If anyone is looking for a true jungle experience, then Table Rock is the place to go! The rooms, views, and property were beautiful and we will stay there again if we ever make it back to Belize.
reviews.title: Magnificent eco-resort in the jungle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the 5 night honeymoon package, and it was absolutely amazing. The cabin is surrounded by jungle and the noises at night really sooth you to sleep. Even the shower was beautiful - you had views of trees and the water pressure was perfect. The service was on top of everything, from Mike and Jose at the front office to the waitstaff at the restaurant to housekeeping. Everyone was so welcoming and inviting and willing to attend to your every wish. The food - this was something we miss the most! Every dish was delectable, and we would return just to have another meal by Chef George. Owners Colleen and Alan were very personable and we enjoyed talking to them when they were around. Part of the package included tours, and the tour guides were all punctual and personable and we enjoyed everything that we saw. Truthfully, the package allowed us not to worry about any detail because all of the details were already taken care of, and that made the honeymoon even more special. This is a perfect destination for a honeymoon or a retreat.
reviews.title: The best place in the jungle!

description: Table Rock Jungle Lodge is an eco-lodge in a canopied rainforest setting unlike any other in the Cayo Distict of Belize. With only 6 cabanas on our 105-acre Macal River reserve, you can enjoy the intimate rainforest setting and the sights and sounds of the Belizean jungle. Hike, swim, canoe, birdwatch, or just indulge in serious relaxation. Close to all the major Mayan archaeological sites and natural wonders of Belize, and only 5 miles outside of San Ignacio, Table Rock is the ideal location for your next adventure holiday.
